title: Introduction to React JS
description: React is a popular JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It was developed by Facebook, and is often used for building single-page applications and mobile applications.

title: Components in React JS
description: In React, a component is a piece of code that represents a part of a user interface. Components are the building blocks of a React application, and can be reused throughout the application.

title: State in a React class component
description: In a class-based React component, the state is an object that stores the component's internal data and determines the component's behavior. The state object can be updated using the setState method, which causes the component to re-render and update the UI to reflect the new state.

title: The useState() hook in React JS
description: The useState hook is a feature in React that allows you to add state to functional components. Prior to the introduction of hooks, state could only be used in class-based components.

title: The useEffect() hook in React JS
description: The useEffect hook is a feature in React that allows you to perform side effects in functional components. Side effects are operations that have an effect on something outside the component itself, such as making an API call or updating the DOM.

title: Introduction to Redux state management technique
description: Redux is a predictable state management library for JavaScript applications. It is often used with libraries such as React or Angular for building user interfaces.

title: How to reverse an array in JavaScript?
description: The reverse method modifies the original array in place and returns a reference to the modified array. It is a simple and efficient way to reverse an array, but it is not suitable for all cases because it mutates the original array.

title: How to create a 'slug' in JavaScript
description: Slug is a term used for a string that can be used as a URL. Generally, a blog post's title will be converted to a slug, so that the url is user and SEO friendly.
